description: [Status: stable] [Name: missing-return-type-class-method] [Message: Missing return type annotation for classmethod {name}] What it does Checks that class methods have return type annotations. Why is this bad? Type annotations are a good way to document the return types of functions. They also help catch bugs, when used alongside a type checker, by ensuring that the types of any returned values, and the types expected by callers, match expectation. Example class Foo: @classmethod def bar(cls): return 1 Use instead: class Foo: @classmethod def bar(cls) -> int: return 1

lint.flake8-annotations.suppress-none-re.option_description:
Whether to suppress ANN200-level violations for functions that meet
either of the following criteria:

Contain no return statement.
Explicit return statement(s) all return None (explicitly or
  implicitly).



Example usage:

pyproject.tomlruff.toml


[tool.ruff.lint.flake8-annotations]
suppress-none-returning = true



[lint.flake8-annotations]
suppress-none-returning = true
